titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. James Hall and Green Carter, Indictment
CWG7634

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Fleming Circuit Court
The Commonwealth of Kentucky
against } Indictment
James Hall & Green Carter

The Grand Jury of Fleming County in the name and by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky accuse James Hall and Green Carter of the crime of murder committed as follows, The said James Hall and Green Carter on the 27th day of March 1863 in the county aforesaid feloniously and with malice aforethought killed and murdered Alexander McGregor by shooting him with a gun and pistol --
Against the peace and dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

Geo M. Thomas
Attorney for the Commonwealth

A Copy
Attest John M Harbeson Clerk
Fleming Circuit Court

Commonwealth
vs } Indictment for murder
James Hall & others
Filed 11. day of November 1865
A true Bill
Thos R. Botts
Foreman

Witnesses
Johnson Phelps
Jno. R. Hawkins
Mary Ann McGregor
Isaac E. Johnson

Fee for this copy 50c
Paid by Amos Davis
John M Harbeson
C. F. C. C.
